nodes.text: Dragon was a roleplaying game magazine that ran for 430 issues, from 1976 to 2013. It was one of two official magazines providing source material for the Dungeons & Dragons role-playing game, the other being Dungeon. During its history the magazine was also known as The Dragon and Dragon Magazine, and was released by three different publishers: TSR, Inc., Wizards of the Coast, and Paizo Publishing.

Dragon Magazine issues 157 (May 1990) and 200 (December 1993) provided supplementary material for West End Games' Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game. However, these articles were released outside of the Lucasfilm licensing process.
Issue 157 included the article "For the Greater Good" by Carl Sargent, while issue 200 included the adventure "The Galaxy Dragon and crew" by Bill Slavicsek.
